basics.name: Patrick D. Holmes
basics.label: Roboticist
basics.summary: Seeking a career in building robots that safely help people.

work.company: Ford Center for Autonomous Vehicles at the University of Michigan
work.summary: Safe trajectory planning and control of autonomous robots.
highlights: Developed a robust trajectory-tracking controller for a robotic arm with bounded error despite model uncertainty.
Augmented the Recursive Newton-Euler Algorithm to operate over sets of desired trajectories plus tracking error.

Created novel receding-horizon reachability-based trajectory planner that satisfies collision-avoidance and torque limit constraints in the presence of static and dynamic obstacles, model uncertainty and tracking error.

courses: MECHENG 543 - Analytical and Computational Dynamics I
MECHENG 561 - Design of Digital Control Systems
MECHENG C85 - Introduction to Solid Mechanics
MECHENG 108 - Mechanical Behaviors of Engineering Materials
MECHENG 120 - Computational Biomechanics Across Multiple Scales
MECHENG 135 - Design of Microprocessor-based Mechanical Systems

awards.summary: One of 28 senior PhD students selected to present.

awards.title: Best Student Paper Award
awards.awarder: ASME Dynamic Systems and Control Conference (DSCC)
awards.summary: For the publication ''Safe, aggressive quadrotor flight via reachability-based trajectory design.''

awards.title: Drake Scholar
